title: An idea that would improve upon the Ruby Sightstone
body:
So far the only item that builds out of the {{item:2049}} Sightstone is the {{item:2045}} Ruby Sightstone, right? 
Not many people build it until their last item, some not at all. I was thinking of ways to improve this, maybe making it cheaper or something... and then I came up with what I think is a decent idea.

Sightstone enchantments. I didn't come up with any great ideas for enchantments but here's just a few suggestions off the top of my head to show you what I mean.

Ruby Sightstone = Holds 5 charges instead of 4.
Emerald Sightstone = Vision area is increased by 20%
Topaz Sightstone = Wards can be placed from 33% further away.
Diamond Sightstone = Wards last 30 seconds longer.
Onyx Sightstone = Vision area is decreased to 20%, but the first enemy champion that is spotted by it will be Revealed for 5 seconds.


These are just examples, ignore them if you want. But the concept itself... what do you think?

replies.body:
First off, I'm pretty disappointed that I did a ctrl+f "Taric" and found no good jokes in this thread.

To the actual suggestion, the idea of having several sightstone enchantments is interesting, though I do wonder how much it could really serve to address the problem you're seeking to solve. If I had to guess, I'd say that the reason it's not commonly upgraded until later in the game is due to the fact that it doesn't add a ton of combat stats. However, it may also be that it's because it doesn't really add a new unique passive, which is essentially what your suggestion does. That said, I do wonder if spending gold on a non-combat passive would also lack appeal.

I'd also ask, is people not upgrading their Sightstones until very late in the game even an issue? Would players actually be more interested in Sightstone if they felt compelled to upgrade it before buying their Mikael's, Locket, Righteous Glory, etc.?
tbh, I feel like sighstone has been pretty overshadowed by the trinkets. Since the sightstone doesn't give me any interesting stats, I'd rather have another item and use ward trinket instead.

To be honest if Ruby sightstone had some sort of ward regeneration effect like GST does, then i'd be much more inclined to buy it. I honestly hate buying Ruby because that overall it doesn't really do anything major for me, it feels like an upgrade that's just sort of tacked on so we can say we have something else to build, so we largely ignore it in favor of items that will help us.

There is a case to be made on whether upgrading sightstones are a good thing to encourage (To maintain distance from the ward bot archetype) but i feel there's also a case to be made about endgame items fulfilling their purposes, or at least having items of the same tier being some sort of significant upgrade (I.E.  Upgrading a B.F. Sword to an IE, ER, BT, etc.) When you upgrade nearly every other item to its fullest point you feel like you have gained the most out of that slot based on the strength of that item, but Ruby Sightstone does very little to make itself distinct or even necessary past the original. The lack of a proper upgrade to fulfill an endgame fantasy for our sightstones ends up in a position wherein we still basically operate on 5 items (Which we kind of always have). Sightstone is very powerful yes, but at this point i feel Supports are almost pigeonholed into it so we can have our wards maintained, but even then in prolonged stays Sightstone quickly loses its effectiveness as fights relocate around the map and your vision requirements become further and further from where you originally needed them, leading to the loss of so many wards due to the 3 ward cap (I don't hate this, just saying a good 70% of my wards are killed by me to maintain combat vision).

I like that supports are encouraged to buy more items i really do, but since Sightstone is core to our build path, I do kind of wish that it had a better endgame fantasy like almost every other item of its calibur.

IF, only IF, Riot thinks that us not upgrading sightstone is an Issue, I'd say that I don't do it because I don't feel the need to have more charges, I'd much rather have 100 extra hp than the extra charges, or anything.
why: Early game the charges are used just to check Dragon an keypoints, so 3 are enough and I'd place the 4th if we were to teamfight inside a brush.

Late-game I don't need more charges because I'd use them to avoid face-checking, but the cast range isn't enough and It'd be dangerous anyway

Have the upgraded Sightstones give different variants to the Exhaust Spell, like increased duration, or armor/MR shred, or better slow, or on a stretch, targeting an ally to buff them with similar stats as those normally taken away. Possibly not first, but early enough, methinks.

Hm... I mean, ideally we'd have enchants on several (sets of) items that all enhance summoner spells (Like 100AP items having enchants to improve ignite, barrier, or clarity; or sightstone/gold gen items enhancing exhaust, heal, or clairvoyance; &c. &c.)

Well, I certainly wouldn't mind seeing ALL the Summoner Spells being enhanced by in-game items at some point. But assuming every Spell is linked to one Item, we have to consider that if we don't want a specific role getting a specific buffed spell. (Like the laners taking the various Smite Enchants.)

Say you have an enchant that buffs Ignite's range; we couldn't put that enchant on an item like Bloodthirster or ADCs would grab it every game, and then Mages would no longer use it, and swap to, say Barrier.

Another tangent would be to have a few items (say one core item per champion class) enchants designated to different spells. Taking back Sightstone, one could buff Exhaust, and another for each of Heal, Barrier and Clairvoyance. Or just have all items buff one Spell each and prevent stacking, this way people can customize Spells via their builds.

Plenty of potential. I'd still rather just see Sightstone removed, vision transferred to trinkets entirely, and Spells can still become buffed via itemization.

I've actually written a whole thing up on this at one point or another, but yeah, the idea was that a set of items would get enhancements for a set of spells- maybe thematic sets (I.E. items that give more gold value to AP or AD enhance ignite, items that have a sizable utility passive enhance clairvoyance, clarity, and exhaust; items that give defensive stats more than anything enhance heal and barrier-- Alternatively, reverse it so that offensive items buff the defensive spells and defensive items buff the offensive spells (This would be better for balance)) or sets that attempt to appeal to champion archetypes (I.E. lifesteal items make ignite heal a bit of the damage dealt, while AP items cause ignite's damage for the first 3 ticks to double and halves the remainder. Definitely choices within the sets, though- like 3 enchants that can be taken on any items that can enhance ignite, and these add an extra enchant.)

I personally like the ammendment on the first idea best; so defensive items (all of them, but you're limited to enchanting ONE) enhance ignite and exhaust, so an adc or mage can pick between either getting the stats they want or making the summoner spell more potent (therefore theoretically giving them a higher total power level, but a much longer window between power, as the spell would have to get a significant jump in strength to even make it an option, but it still has the 2-5 minute cooldown where you'd be weaker against your opponent.). It would also give most everybody the chance to enhance their summoner spell, as even adc's should be getting one defensive item and a tank without any offense whatsoever probably can't do their job right (there's no threat, so they aren't worth focusing. Nautilus with an Echo, however... that at least will do some significant damage through a fight, and can thus be an effective threat to shift focus to.)

Either way, it definitely needs refining before Riot could even consider revealing any tidbit to us about it.

I would love another reason beyond the current extra ward/little hp to get ruby ss. I almost never build it until super late game and even that doesn't happen very often. The idea of different types intrigues me. 

And if the gem names stick Taric better have something to say when buying each 😁

I made a relevant thread on another idea that I feel would fit better 2 hours ago here:
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/25WNa33c-buffing-ruby-sightstone

But to answer your questions, I don't think people not upgrading sightstone until later is the issue, I think the main issue is that upgrading sightstone again feels extremely unsatisfying as the extra health is quite minimal and it feels like you don't really get any benefit from upgrading it at all, especially as a utility support who doesn't really get focused or take very much damage anyway.
800 gold to upgrade trinkets to a sightstone + 250 gold for the ward regeneration? That way there would still be an investment but we would be able to do so without sacrificing an item slot.

I main support and as a support main the reason i don't upgrade the sight stone is because there can be only 3 wards on the map and u get 4 in the Sight stone, why should i get the extra ward in ruby Sight Stone when every time i go back to base i get 4 more wards? And the extra health don't justify the 800 gold needed until it end of the game i got an extra 800 gold

It´s not about - just upgrade it last.
It´s about: "Full build? Check! Early Items sold? Check! Boots sold? Check! Trinket Upgraded? Check! Pot bought and on Full CD? Check! OK maybe I could upgrade the sightstone now. ^^" It´s upgraded because it existsts not because it would do anything for you or your Team.

This upgrade is like.. nothing! One Ward charge and 250HP for 800Gold... H4H4H4. xD 
+ 3 Ward charges
+ 1 on Wardlimit
+ Some combat Stats
+ Some Ward depended Passive´s 

That would do something, but in its current state noone would ever upgrade a sightstone beacause he needs it! (exept rare High Level Team Ranked situations MAYBE)

Actualy the idea for having enchanted support items when having sightstone is actualy not a bad idea. See the idea here:

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/HLv72EGu-what-if-ruby-sightstone-upgraded-support-items

I don't think the {{item:2045}}  is as much of an issue as the {{item:2049}}  itself. 

The Health benefits mostly Tank supports, but is a bit of gold waste on others. Conversely Tanks are currently the favoured type of Support. 

Not sure if it is because of Sighstone, but the synergy between Sightstone and {{item:3097}} does give them a better early and mid game. Takes a while for supports to get gold for their third item.

Tanks are more likely to upgrade Ruby Sightstone too.

Did you also try Ctrl+F "Pokemon"?

More seriously, support itemization is the most dynamic in the game.  They are always the champions who are itemizing for what fits that specific moment in that specific game.  ADC's are almost completely static in their itemization, and mid mages and assassins aren't far behind.  They build these items in this order and only detour if they absolutely have to because they NEED QSS or Zhonya's or whatever.  Tanks and Bruisers aren't a whole lot better.  Bruisers build either Triforce or BorK, depending more on the champion than the game, and then go straight into tank stats.  They might even go tank stats first, and the tank will go straight to tank stats.  Their only real consideration is whether they need armor or MR first.

Support, however, just builds Sightstone, fairly quickly.  After that, they look at what is needed for that game.  Giving them more options makes the role more interesting.  They don't get to build as many items, so each item feels more meaningful, and having options makes them feel like they have a greater contribution to the game from a role that always feels underpowered by a little.

For instance, providing movement speed to allies that are in the vision radius of your wards, or causing wards to temporarily grant true sight when placed. Things that I wouldn't want *every* support to have access to, but could be cool on a new champion designed around the mechanic(s). 

As a support, I want to build items to help my team. I already put down 800 gold on a sightstone to control vision. Spending more on upgrading that honestly would not feel as good as picking up a talisman or aegis, or any other item that serves a particular purpose that my team needs.

People not upgrading their sightstone is a **very real issue** when **an upgrade for it actually exists**. Ruby Sightstone does not see play because it is essentially an extra ward. Only specific occasions call for the added health of the item, making upgrading it at all a waste of in-game gold.

Trinkets have made the sightstone and its upgraded version a lot less exciting. People want a reason to use Ruby Sightstone other than having a little bit of extra gold after you've bought everything else.

The thing is, being forced to spent another 800 gold into vision isn't really exciting. I would say it's less exciting than a shabby slot effiency upgrade which encourages you to buy actual combat items.

There is always the choice of changing the sightstone to function along side a summoner skill like say Exhaust.  Much like Smite is tied into some powerful jungle items, it might be interesting to see some of the other summoner skills tied into items.

Personally I love the idea of sightstone enchantments, but I would prefer them to have combat value. Extra health is cool but for the cost, you get better value elsewhere, generally speaking. The obvious paradox from a design standpoint is how do you make it better without making it something all 5 players feel they have to build. To that end, strong offensive bonuses are pretty much off the table. However, stats/passives enjoyed by junglers and supports could totally be a viable thing imo.

What I think would be effective to that end is stats like MR, Armor, CDR, Gold Gain, Movespeed, and Mana/Health regen. Those stats, ofc, are useful to everyone but even a top laner wouldn't be encouraged to take it over, say, deadman's plate, as long as the stat gain is kept within reason. I do feel this is an important issue the devs should look into because quite frankly, while the utility and value of sightstone is undeniable, it just doesn't feel very fun to give up one of your 6 slots to something that doesn't help you win fights (directly).

I really build sightstone and I often upgrade it, especially when I'm winning hard the game, so I can control easily the map and make new plays. Ruby Sightstone seems limited IMO. I never feel I have enough wards when needed. Maybe you should allow us to upgrade our trinket from lv1, so supports doesn't need to buy it always. It would promoto alternative supports like {{champion:63}} and {{champion:161}}, who hate building sightstone, but love building AP or magic penetration early on.

What would you think about having the wards from a tier three sightstone give bonuses. 
For example: Speedstone-- Once a ward that has been placed from Speedstone has been out for 30 seconds, all allied champions in the radius of its vision get a 5% speed boost. 
Variants of that could be a small shield, small damage buff of some sort, etc. 
I feel like that would encourage jockeying for position around objectives a lot more than it is now, rewarding teams that grouped and defended their set ups. 

The delay is there to make it so wards don't become things you just randomly throw down during team fights for the bonuses, they are meant to be things that are set up and defended, and it encourages teams to clear out enemy wards around objectives well. Basically, I feel this would add to interactions between teams around objectives, as well as letting the warding game feel a bit more meaningful for supports.
Mabye it could regenerate wards?So supports wouldn't need to B all the time to recharge their wards.

love the idea i think it would give the support role a lot more diveristy.

i really like the idea and i think it would give you more options depending on the current state of your team and the other team

A reason to build a higher level sightstone might be nice, but truth is it would be just like the different enchants/blade combinations for junglers. There will be one that is superior to all others (increased vision area, for example) and would be the only one built. There aren't reasons to have the other "enchants" so it would just be wasted coding. Like poacher's knife or essence reaver, they would just be wasted item code. As we have it right now, adding the little bit of health it has is an alright option to upgrade your sightstone to. It doesn't make it an overpowered option for someone trying to scale their percent health, but does provide a little resistance from dying in the late game.

Often times, the best way to come back in a game is through vision. Yes, the trinkets are nice, but once I get the sightstone I swap my trinket for either red or blue depending on what is needed from my team. For those who are behind but need a substantial buy for vision, these upgrades would be helpful.
